Allez! Jake Farrell on Cycling

Cycling is a maddening, frustrating and unpredictable sport. The vageries of it's variable institutions and the way that they relate to each other is difficult to fully understand. It's strangeness has been fully crystallised by the case of Alberto Contador and the clenbuterol tainted steak. (Thumbnail credit Image: scarlatti2004 via Flickr Creative Commons)

"A black day for the sport" as Ireland miss out on 2015 World Cup place

Henry Cowen argues that the decision made by the ICC today to restrict the 2015 World Cup to ten teams is disproportionately unfair on an Irish side that has made so much progress (Thumbnail credit The ICC has turned its back on the likes of Kevin O'Brien. Image: najeebkhan2009 via Flickr Creative Commons)

Capello's captaincy debacle

Luke Gardener examines the chaos of the English captaincy (Thumbnail credit Capello has settled on the one captain he wants for England. Image: Dekuwa via Flickr Creative Commons)

Team of the 2011 Six Nations

Joseph Cormack dons his selector hat to pick his team of the 2011 Six Nations (Thumbnail credit Tom Palmer, second-row in our team of the tournament and a contender for player of the Six Nations. Image: fat dad via Flickr Creative Commons)

Ten things we learned from the 2011 Six Nations

Alan McCormick evaluates ten things we learned from the 2011 Six Nations (Thumbnail credit England's trophy, but Ireland denied them the Grand Slam. Image: lhourahane via Flickr Creative Commons)

Formula One 2011: A preview

Dong-Oh Shin previews another season of high-octane Formula One drama (Thumbnail credit Can Sebastian Vettel, pictured here in 2007, claim the title again this year? Image: Red~Cyan via Flickr Creative Commons )

Two tries from captain Weir get men's firsts back to winning ways

A brace of tries from captain Tom Weir led to a 24-14 victory for the men's rugby firsts over Leeds Metropolitan Carnegie seconds on Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Draw against Leeds Met confirms women's badminton runners up spot

The women's badminton side ended their season with a 2-2 draw against Leeds Metropolitan Carnegie thirds (Thumbnail credit The women's badminton side, pictured here against Durham last week, have had a fantastic season, finishing second in BUCS 2B)

Squash win over fellow strugglers eases relegation fears

A win over fellow strugglers Sheffield Hallam helped to allay the relegation fears of the men's squash team (Thumbnail credit The squash team, pictured here against Northumbria in January, have a BUCS cup final to look forward to on Friday. Image: Peter Iveson)

Comfortable victory caps off fine season for women's hockey firsts

Goals from Charlie Bartlett and two from Rachel Faustino gave York a comfortable victory over Northumbria University seconds on Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Late show secures heavy victory for men's hockey thirds

The men's hockey thirds hammered five goals past a beleaguered Leeds Trinity All Saints College on Wednesday (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Points shared in feisty encounter on the JLD

The men's hockey firsts were held to a 2-2 draw on the JLD today, with the Durham thirds fighting back to secure a point on the last day of the season (Thumbnail credit Image: Katie Davis)

Goodricke finish second after 2-0 win over James

Goals from Jon Sharpe and Matt Burke secured a win and a successful end to this term's play for an impressive Goodricke side (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Langwith hang on for a point against out of sorts Alcuin

Alcuin and Langwith played out a 1-1 draw on the last College Football morning of the term, Bradley Wood scoring a late equaliser for Phil Bowers' side (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Ten man Derwent claim title in controversial clash with Wentworth

Derwent clinched the college football league title in dramatic fashion, clinging on to beat Wentworth 1-0 after their captain Matt Hallam was sent off with over half an hour to play (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Superb women's basketballers edged out in semi-final clash

Last Wednesday York women's basketballers went up against the University of Hull in the BUCS semi-final but couldn't cap a superb season, losing 51-44 (Thumbnail credit York's women's basketballers in action earlier this month against Sheffield Hallam. Image: Jivan Mohanty)

Derwent complete rugby double with thumping win over spirited Goodricke

Derwent lifted the rugby college cup after overpowering a spirited Goodricke side to claim their second trophy in a week (Thumbnail credit Two try man Tolga Necar looks on as Derwent take on Goodricke. Image: Philippa Grafton)

Preview: College Rugby Tens Tournament

Freddy Harris takes us through the term's runners and riders for this year's College Rugby tens tournament (Thumbnail credit James key man Alex Muntus is held up in the recent College Final against Derwent)

Jubliant men's lacrosse team produce comeback to reach cup final

A decisive goal from York captain Phil Harrold secured York's place in the final of the men's Northern Conference Cup (Thumbnail credit Victory for York saw them exact revenge for a narrow loss against the same opposition just a week ago. Image: Peter Iveson)

Men's rugby firsts lose out to promotion rivals Manchester

York went agonisingly close to matching BUCS Northern Conference leaders Manchester on the 22 acres, losing 24-19 in a tight game that saw their impressive home record tarnished by defeat (Thumbnail credit York were just one try away from drawing against their title rivals in this bruising encounter)

Nouse Sport Podcast

By James Bithell

Another week, another Nouse Sport Podcast. The perfect accompaniment to that boring essay. Alternatively, pour yourself a deep bath, have a glass of wine and enjoy (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Sam Asfahani secures second year with comfortable victory in YUSU elections

Sam Asfahani has won a second year as York Sport President, fending off a spirited challenge from Ben McGladdery. Asfahani, the third YUSU incumbent to retain a sabbatical position in two years, will hope to utilise the mandate afforded to him by a formidable margin of victory to further his election pledges into 2012

Derwent march on but Goodricke sustain pressure on the league leaders

By James Bithell

Derwent furthered their title ambitions after they secured a hard-fought 1-0 win over a plucky James side (Thumbnail credit Team of the week: Nouse picks the eleven that made the difference for their respective colleges)

James undone by defiant Derwent

Derwent have confounded the received wisdom regarding college rugby by battling to superb 12-10 win over a usually imperious James side in the final of the collegiate rugby season (Thumbnail credit Photo: Peter Iveson)

Darts team win national tournament

The University of York Darts Club travelled to Liverpool this weekend and secured a memorable victory in the UDUK University Cup finals day with a comprehensive 7-3 scoreline over Leeds University

Clinical Sabres batter York Centurions

A devastating second quarter performance from the visiting Sheffield Sabres halted York's quest for their first ever berth in the BUAFL Northern Conference Play-offs (Thumbnail credit The heavy defeat for the American footballers comes in the wake of their first ever victory just weeks ago against Hull. Photo: Philippa Grafton)

Behind the microphone

Sports Editor Henry Cowen talks to Guy Mowbray, BBC commentator and York native, about the pressures of his job and how well he really gets on with summariser Mark Lawrenson (Thumbnail credit Guy Mowbray is one of the BBC's top commentators and has come a long way since starting with Clubcall. Photo: BBC)

The Mixer at Elections

By James Bithell

The Mixer is happy to be the mouthpiece of the regime. It is our sole purpose to spout the carefully engineered propaganda put forward by the Asfahani administration (Thumbnail credit Be my Guest: Pure bromance as Guessfahani smile for the cameras. Photo: Peter Iveson)

Whole in one - world golf in a nutshell

Sam Morgan produces another blog on the goings-on in the world of golf (Thumbnail credit Image: Keith Allison via Flickr Creative Commons)

Semi-final heartbreak for men's fencers

The men's fencers went out of the BUCS Cup at the semi-final stage yesterday, losing 132-115 to the University of Birmingham (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)
